name: Polytracker
description: Terminal application in Go to identify high-performing Polymarket traders, analyze their strategies using Claude AI, and track their performance.

steps: Initialize Go module `polytracker`
Implement `config` package using Viper
Define configuration structure (API keys, DB path, Theme defaults)
Create default `config.yaml` generation logic
Verify config loading and environment variable overrides
Initialize SQLite connection using `go-sqlite3`
Implement schema migration system
Create tables: `traders`, `trades`, `markets`, `market_snapshots`, `analyses`, `watchlist`, `settings`
Implement basic CRUD repositories for Traders and Trades
Verify database file creation and table structure
Implement CLI entry point (e.g., using Cobra or standard flag package)
Add flags: `--min-trades`, `--output`, `--theme`, `--claude-endpoint`
Implement subcommands: `scan`, `analyze`, `export`
Verify `polytracker --help` displays correct flags and commands
Create Makefile with standard targets: build, test, run, clean, lint
Add cross-compilation support
Implement dependency management (tidy)
Verify all Makefile targets execute correctly
Create `polymarket` package with `resty` client
Implement Gamma API methods (Market metadata)
Implement CLOB API methods (Orderbook, Trades)
Implement rate limiting and error handling
Verify API connectivity with unit tests
Implement `Scanner` service to fetch recent market activity
Extract unique trader addresses from activity
Calculate metrics: Win Rate, P&L, ROI, Volume
Implement batch processing to respect rate limits
Store scanned results in `traders` table
Implement deep-dive fetcher for specific trader history
Fetch and store historical market context (snapshots) for trades
Implement caching logic to avoid re-fetching existing data
Verify data completeness for analysis (Entry price, Exit price, timestamps)
Initialize Bubble Tea application model
Implement main application layout (Header, Content, Footer/Statusbar)
Implement Tab navigation system (Scan, Leaderboard, Watchlist, Settings)
Handle global keybindings (q, ?, 1-4)
Verify TUI launches and navigation works
Define `Theme` struct and color definitions
Implement color palettes: Dracula, Nord, Gruvbox, Catppuccin, Tokyo
Create style helper functions using Lip Gloss
Apply current theme to TUI base components
Implement `bubble-table` for trader rankings
Bind table to `traders` database query
Implement sorting (Win%, P&L) and pagination
Add row selection and 'Enter' key event to navigate to Detail view
Verify leaderboard renders data correctly
Design Profile and Stats summary panels
Implement 'Recent Trades' list view
Add keybindings: 'a' (Analyze), 'w' (Watch), 't' (All Trades)
Implement 'Back' navigation to Leaderboard
Verify trader details match selected trader
Implement database queries for Watchlist
Create Watchlist UI table/list
Implement 'Add/Remove' logic from other screens
Allow adding notes to watchlist items
Verify persistence of watchlist items
Initialize `anthropic-sdk-go` client
Implement `ThesisPrompt` template generation from trader data
Create `AnalyzeTrader` service method
Handle API errors and token limits
Verify prompt generation and mock API response
Create Analysis progress screen (Fetching data... Analyzing...)
Implement Markdown renderer for Claude response
Add actions: Save to file, Copy, Retry
Verify analysis flow from Trigger to Result display
Implement CSV export logic for Leaderboard
Implement Thesis Markdown export
Wire up `export` CLI command
Verify generated files contain correct data
